title: Riot wants pre-school social interactions
body: Riot doesnt want people to actually express themselves. They want obligatory politically correct phrases to be regurgitated at the right times and a perfect world with no conflict. In a competitive game. Its kind of a joke. Any conflict no matter how minor is responded to with disdain and punishment. They are trying to inculcate every player with a preschool mentality of sharing and caring and that everyone is always a winner no matter what. So if you express yourself, even as you would in real life amongst friends or any REAL people in any REAL social situation, you're deemed "toxic". Which is a nonsensical phrase used to refer to anyone who doesnt subscribe to this preschool mentality of "dont say no no words, you might hurt timmy's feelings". Gg riot. Should rename your game to "Little League Of Funtime and Happiness" and designate it an official safe-space. Hey, you could appeal to the millenials and gender-fluid who need a happy place. Honestly, just remove the chat system. Not everyone is always going to adhere to your silly take on morality. The only thing you people want to see in the chat is the obligatory: "gg" "have fun" "nice play!" and stupid PC shit like that.

replies.body:
mature adults actually know how to respect each other more and give properly worded constructive criticisms.

Compare that to the immature beings that like to throw unproductive insults at each other.

I think Riot is onto something good.
Wow! An educated comment! TAKE MY UPVOTE!

I dunno bout you, but I don't call friends or people I know f%%%%ts or n%%%%rs nor do I call them retards or autistic, and I definitely don't tell my friends or people IRL to go commit suicide.

Riot is trying to promote ***civility*** and ***sportsmanship***, not hate filled, offensive trash talking. There's a major difference between competitive trash talking and the things you're talking about that would violate what people consider safe spaces. You need to seriously reevaluate your life if civility is beyond your capabilities.
what? i tell my friends "hah, you're fucking dumb" and random stuff like that all the time. its not a big deal. only to riots preschool mentality its a huge grevious crime.

> [{quoted}](name=GaryTheGazelle,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=9EITqWFG,comment-id=00010000,timestamp=2017-02-03T23:15:11.041+0000)
>
> what? i tell my friends "hah, you're fucking dumb" and random stuff like that all the time. its not a big deal. only to riots preschool mentality its a huge grevious crime.

Random people on the internet trying to play a tense 40 minute game are not your buddies, pal.

they are not exactly 3 yo who cant take criticism from a stranger in the video game too. just adding my point of view: 

yea negative behaviour is as the term says negative, but people overreacting because smn told them they played badly are not great teammates too. 

In the ideal world both sides would be better, "negative" summoners will hold their nerves better and those oversensitve snowflakes would take criticism with the grain of salt.

> [{quoted}](name=GoleBilon,realm=EUNE,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=9EITqWFG,comment-id=0001000000000000,timestamp=2017-02-03T23:35:38.595+0000)
>
> they are not exactly 3 yo who cant take criticism from a stranger in the video game too. just adding my point of view: 
> 
> yea negative behaviour is as the term says negative, but people overreacting because smn told them they played badly are not great teammates too. 
> 
> In the ideal world both sides would be better, "negative" summoners will hold their nerves better and those oversensitve snowflakes would take criticism with the grain of salt.

But it's VASTLY ANNOYING to play with someone who is trying to tell you, aggressively and poorly, how to play the game, while you are trying to make up for your mistakes OR trying to play and the other person just perceives mistakes. That is what we call 'tilt'. And it makes it harder to play, hampers the mood, and makes the game almost a chore sometimes.

its also VASTLY ANNOYING to play with oversensitive guy that gets offended over everything. It makes harder to play when the guy that is already super behind does not listen to you because he refuses to talk with  " TOXIC FLAMER " and constantly dies because he cant think straight. Its fucking annoying that people call everything toxicity , its fucking tilting when someone dies 5 times in lane and when you tell them  " man stop being fucking bad , maybe just swap bot and farm there " he gets offended and dies 5 more times in lane making the game impossible to win.


It's a game where everybody is competetive, there are both sides of this coin so yea , negative behaviour does not help. But its not hard to understand someone's frustration and just suck it up for 30 minutes to achieve mutual goal of winning. Be the fucking bigger man, because being crying kid that gets offended by everything has same negative impact on the game.  

And no im not defending flamers/negative players ,  i'm just fucking annoyed with both of them and both behaviours ruin my game and in the end its a shitshow in chat. I understand midlaner that is behind because his jungler sucks and he cant do shit same as i understand the jungler that has bad game but for gods fucking sake , nobody should care this much about this fucking chat that it influences his gameplay. From my experience 90% of negative behaviour is venting frustration , so plz , i beg you treat it as venting frustration and be the bigger man. This community started to care more about those fucking reports than actuall game and its fucking sad

> [{quoted}](name=GoleBilon,realm=EUNE,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=9EITqWFG,comment-id=000100000000000000000000,timestamp=2017-02-04T00:15:26.676+0000)
>
> man stop being fucking bad 
> 

Is not how you talk to people as an adult.

how old are you exactly ? are you employed ? did you ever work in a high stress situations  ?

because you dont seem to know how world works

> [{quoted}](name=GoleBilon,realm=EUNE,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=9EITqWFG,comment-id=00010000000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2017-02-04T00:19:46.963+0000)
>
> how old are you exactly ? are you employed ? did you ever work in a high stress situations  ?
> 
> because you dont seem to know how world works

Tell me, how exactly is telling someone to stop being bad helping them improve? Answer: it's not. A better way to phrase that sentence is "Hey, I can tell you're struggling to farm in mid lane, so maybe just swap bot and farm there". This way you're not starting off with a poor attitude/an insult and instead are just suggesting a solution to help them out more. There's a right way and a wrong way to tell someone something, and the example I provided is a much better way than the example you provided.

where did i say that its helping anybody in anyway ? its venting frustration , its a reasonable behaviour from a person to release their frustration once in a while. And yes you are right in a perfect world everybody would use phrases that you wrote , sadly we dont live in utopia and people may struggle to  keep their nerves. 


My overall point is that people that get offended easily respond to toxicity and that creates even more toxicity. If only they could suck it up once in a while and dont pay attention , let the fuming guy chill out or just do what he says it would be beneficial for both of us. 

I myself get frustrated with this game sometimes , and yea i may burst and tell someone he is fucking bad ( nothing more tho ) and i often apologise after when im cool. Thats why i understand the other side and i let the negative guy call me bad , i do not take it personally i dont get offended this way mostly ( not always obv ) he cools and we finish the game with good communication. But sorry when i see the oversensitive guys that call everybody "flamer" for literally anything i'd rather have those toxic guys that try hard

> [{quoted}](name=GoleBilon,realm=EUNE,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=9EITqWFG,comment-id=0001000000000000000000000000000000010000,timestamp=2017-02-04T00:39:27.934+0000)
>
> where did i say that its helping anybody in anyway ? its venting frustration , its a reasonable behaviour from a person to release their frustration once in a while. And yes you are right in a perfect world everybody would use phrases that you wrote , sadly we dont live in utopia and people may struggle to  keep their nerves. 

That's why we have the mute button, to mute the people who start complaining in the chat constantly. Obviously no ones perfect and we all get angry and frustrated every now and then, but we can help reduce how that effects us or others by being smart about how we give our tips/advice to others. We can also just try to choose other outlets for venting our frustration, such as punching a pillow or screaming at the screen.
 
> My overall point is that people that get offended easily respond to toxicity and that creates even more toxicity. If only they could suck it up once in a while and dont pay attention , let the fuming guy chill out or just do what he says it would be beneficial for both of us. 

No arguments there, but of course that's easier said than done. That also comes back to my earlier about using the mute button when people start raging/complaining in the chat.
 
> I myself get frustrated with this game sometimes , and yea i may burst and tell someone he is fucking bad ( nothing more tho ) and i often apologise after when im cool. Thats why i understand the other side and i let the negative guy call me bad , i do not take it personally i dont get offended this way mostly ( not always obv ) he cools and we finish the game with good communication. But sorry when i see the oversensitive guys that call everybody "flamer" for literally anything i'd rather have those toxic guys that try hard

I don't really get offended easily myself either, and I know that I can always just mute and report when someone refuses to stop harassing others. I myself get frustrated as well, usually due to my own poor performances, but I tend to just yell at the monitor or punch a pillow when that happens. Personally though even though I like winning I'd rather have people on my team who are respectful to others and don't mind joking around every now and then than have a flamer on my team, even if the former results in a loss. That's just me though.

As i said we dont live in utopia but every step bring us closer to a better community. 

I myself had enough of both negative people as well as oversensitve snowflakes that cant take criticism and tilt from literally everything. I dont want this community to be more focused around "punishing toxic players " than the game itself. The reporting system does some good but it also does much harm to the game. The report calling phenomenon is the recent sign that its going wrong. People start to care more about punishments for people with whom they argue in game rather than the game. I literally cant remember when was the game where i did not see "report  XXXXXX " in chat and its sad. Report system is here to punish super toxic behaviours , not to casually report everybody that you disagree with and its used in this manner at least from my experience. 

I'm not a big fan of flamers but at least i understand why they react like they react, on the other hand i dont understand people that are oversensitive and when they get offended all they think about is to report the player they argued with.

> [{quoted}](name=GoleBilon,realm=EUNE,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=9EITqWFG,comment-id=000100000000000000000000000000000001000000000000,timestamp=2017-02-04T02:04:46.381+0000)

I dont want this community to be more focused around "punishing toxic players " than the game itself. The reporting system does some good but it also does much harm to the game. The report calling phenomenon is the recent sign that its going wrong. People start to care more about punishments for people with whom they argue in game rather than the game. I literally cant remember when was the game where i did not see "report  XXXXXX " in chat and its sad. Report system is here to punish super toxic behaviours , not to casually report everybody that you disagree with and its used in this manner at least from my experience. 
> 
> I'm not a big fan of flamers but at least i understand why they react like they react, on the other hand i dont understand people that are oversensitive and when they get offended all they think about is to report the player they argued with.

Which is why spamming 'report XXXXX' is also punishable. And the report system has failsafes so it can't be abused. Every time you want to say 'offended', replace it with 'annoyed'. No one is 'offended' by flamers, they are 'annoyed' by flamers.

Nobody takes it as bullying because we fucking work to achieve the same goals and we suck it up and work harder. Is it necessary  ? No its not , but we dont live in perfect world so nobody gets offended when someone burst from frustration because he is working for 14 hours monday to friday for last 2 months because there is not enough employees. 


As a person who works with handicapped people you must have developed high levels of empathy, so why not understand negative summoners ( not toxic that make death threats and use hate speech ) and let them go once in a while to achieve mutual goals ? My point is that because so many players care about toxicity and are easily offended there is even more toxicity.

But we are not in a perfect world but every step brings us closer to this and with this mindset focused around toxicity and the reporting system it is not heallthy for the community , people start to care more about punishing toxic people than their gameplay and its not good.

change the last part to " people start to care more about punishing toxic people than playing the game " .

I dont understand players that think only about reporting someone from the second they got offended , i dont understand how they can get offended by some mild harrasment in the first place. I dont know why do they want to "revenge punishment  " and why do they think its better than actuall speaking their mind. They are not better , they do nothing to improve this community only thing they can do better is hold their nerves but in the end it does not matter because your added value to this community is the same and is equall 0 .

And if you care so much about them be my guest have one from me. 

I wont change my opinion that both negative people and those who get offended need to work together to improve this community , and if it gets me downvoted by those "non-toxic " guys who cant make an effort to understand the other side i dont rly give a crap.

>I dunno bout you, but I don't call friends or people I know f%%%%ts

I mean. everyone I know does lol.
naw, its just that you have to master pre-school social interactions before you can handle the more complex interactions this game requires.

Sounds like someone wants to be able to be prejudiced, racist, sexist, homophobic, and/or otherwise bigoted to get under the enemy team's skin so that they no longer have to win on their own merit but on the distraction and fury of the enemy team.

When you normalize hate speech (by not calling it out and/or punishing it), you implicitly justify treating a person as a second class citizen or even subhuman.

There's a difference between trash talking and being a terrible human being.

> [{quoted}](name=YerroFever,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=9EITqWFG,comment-id=0008,timestamp=2017-02-04T06:58:20.972+0000)

If someone in my team starts to blame a other guy ... I would kick him after ONE warning. 
Get a life, kid.

You can definitely express yourself, but you have to do so in a mature and respectful manner. If you don't or won't then you can expect to be held accountable for your poor behavior, just like in real life. If you want to harass and insult your friends in a full pre-made group and they're all okay with it then that's fine, but just don't do it when around random strangers who won't understand your intentions without an explanation.
